# Optional ROCm-specific dependencies
# Install AFTER the base requirements on a LUMI-G compute node
#
# NOTE: cupy-rocm wheels may not be available for all ROCm versions.
# Check https://docs.cupy.dev/en/stable/install.html#installing-cupy-for-rocm
#
# If cupy-rocm is unavailable, the pipeline falls back to CPU-only mode.
# PyTorch ROCm is another option but heavier.

# Option A: CuPy for ROCm (preferred, lightweight)
# cupy-rocm-5-6  # Uncomment if ROCm 5.6 wheels are available

# Option B: PyTorch ROCm (heavier, but well-supported on LUMI)
# Install via:
#   pip install torch --index-url https://download.pytorch.org/whl/rocm5.6

# Option C: JAX ROCm (experimental)
# jax[rocm]==0.4.25  # Check JAX ROCm support status
